intro: Onobroma, commonly known as the candle bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their showy, lantern-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Onobroma species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated for their unique floral display.
